snippet: Wilson Kipsang kept a one-stride lead over Lelisa Desisa of Ethiopia as they entered Central Park. When Desisa tried to make a move, he pushed Kipsang’s arm away, which seemed to motivate Kipsang.
abstract: Wilson Kipsang of Kenya wins men's race in his first appearance in New York City Marathon, in time of 2 hours 10 minutes 59 seconds; broke into sprint to beat second-place-finisher Lelisa Desisa after he pushed Kipsang's arm while trying to make a move in Central Park.
lead_paragraph: Wilson Kipsang kept a one-stride lead over Lelisa Desisa of Ethiopia as they entered Central Park. When Desisa tried to make a move, he pushed Kipsang’s arm away, which seemed to motivate Kipsang.

headline.seo: New York Marathon 2014: Wilson Kipsang Wins Race and World Majors Bonus
headline.main: Arm Bump Precedes Late Burst in Men’s Race
headline.print_headline: Buffeted by Wind, and One Another
